channel.title: Run.bat Help
channel.description:
I'm using an area 51 source and I edited the Batch file and put this in:
@echo off Title Shadow Pk "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_17\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause
And what shows up in the cmd is this: "Error: Could not load or find Main Class server.Server" So then I deleted server.Server and that didn't work either. Helpppp.
And yes that is my JDK version. Do I need to add a "cd" into the text? Or do I need to delete some chars out of the mysql part?

item.title: Run.bat Help
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

‘server.Server’
It cannot find this class, it should be located as. (i do NOT mean change this in your run.bat, im simply telling you where to check)
‘./bin/server/Server.class’

If that file does exist then make sure that its the same case.

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat Help
item.dc:creator: @Free_Sosa Free Sosa
item.description:
@Free_Sosa wrote:

I’m using an area 51 source and I edited the Batch file and put this in:

@echo off
Title Shadow Pk
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_17\bin\java.exe” -Xmx1000m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
pause

And what shows up in the cmd is this: “Error: Could not load or find Main Class server.Server” So then I deleted server.Server and that didn’t work either. Helpppp.

And yes that is my JDK version. Do I need to add a “cd” into the text? Or do I need to delete some chars out of the mysql part?

Read full topic
